Welcome to Contacts Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.
Args:

user (User): The User object for which to retrieve contacts. db (Session): A database session object used to query the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the contact with that id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. user (User): The User object associated with this Contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact with a specific id

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact with the given id for the given user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.querys_contacts(firstname: str, lastname: str, email: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The querys_contacts function takes in a firstname, lastname, email and user object. It then queries the database for contacts that match any of these parameters. The function returns a list of all matching contacts.

Parameters:

  • firstname – str: Filter the contacts by firstname

  • lastname – str: Filter the contacts by lastname

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query parameters

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the contacts list. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user’s id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactResponse, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactResponse): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is being updated

  • body – ContactResponse: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object, if it exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is trying to confirm their account

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the data to be inserted into the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used to interact with our PostgreSQL database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify that the url parameter is a string

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user to update

  • token – str | None: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

None because it is an async function

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If there is no valid user associated with the given email address or if there are any errors during decoding or creating tokens then an HTTPException will be raised.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an account with that email address and if so, it sends them an email with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes in a UserModel object, which is validated by pydantic. If the email already exists, it will return an HTTP 409 error code (conflict). Otherwise, it will create a new user and send them an email to verify their account.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the new user and a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the current month.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user,

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays today

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactModel object as input, and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.querys_contacts(firstname: str = '', lastname: str = '', email: str = '', db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The querys_contacts function is used to query the contacts table in the database.

The function takes three parameters: firstname, lastname and email. If a parameter is not provided, it will be set to an empty string by default.

Parameters:

  • firstname – str: Pass the firstname of the contact to be queried

  • lastname – str: Search for a contact by lastname

  • email – str: Query the database for a specific contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the type of data that is expected in the url path

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the repository layer

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _current_user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The removed contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no contact is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that is being updated

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded as an avatar. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. This is passed in by the auth_service dependency, which uses JWT tokens to authenticate users and pass them into functions that require authentication. See auth/auth_service for more details on how this works under the hood! db (Session): A database session object used for querying and updating data in our PostgreSQL database using SQLAlchemy’s ORM syntax!

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s information

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent
